name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl is composed of three benzene rings fused linearly. The melting point of benzene is 5.5°C. Each additional phenyl group is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 100°C due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. In this case, we have two additional phenyl groups, which would add (100°C x 2) = 200°C to the melting point.
